## Import and get a sense of data

```{r}
# Import data
data <- read.csv("data/census2.csv")

str(data)

summary(data)
levels(data$Town)
```

## Exploratory data analysis
What are some graphical tools for numerical data? When is one more appropriate than another?
```{r}
# Load packages
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
data %>%
  filter(!Town %in% c("United States", "New Hampshire")) %>%
  select(Town, popTotal, Year) %>%
  mutate(Year = paste0("Yr",Year)) %>%
  spread(Year, popTotal) %>%
  ggplot(aes(reorder(x = Town, Yr2016-Yr2011), y = Yr2016-Yr2011, fill = Yr2016-Yr2011 > 0)) +
  geom_col() +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Population Change between 2007-2011 and 2012-2016",
       x = "Number of People",
       y = NULL)
```
